DPRK Youth League Delegation Leaves for Syria 
    Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League headed by Kim Kyong Ho, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, left Pyongyang Saturday to visit Syria.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kil Chol Hyok, secretary of the C.C., the youth league, and Muhammad Adib Alhani, charge d'affaires ad interim of Syrian embassy in Pyongyang.

Visits
    Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Swedish Foreign Ministry headed by Eva Walder-Brundin, deputy director general for Political Affairs and director of the Department for Asia and the Pacific of the ministry, arrived here by air Saturday.
 It was greeted at the airport by officials concerned and the Swedish ambassador to the DPRK.    
 Meanwhile, Reto Meister, chief representative for Asia-Pacific region of the International Committee of Red Cross, left here on the same day.

Japan's Settlement of Past Urged by Overseas Koreans
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The European Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification and the Society of Koreans for Cooperation in Germany in a joint statement on Mar. 4 reportedly said that the Korean nation would closely watch Japan's settlement of the past in firm solidarity and unity with the justice and conscience of the world.
 If Japan really wants the security and peace of the world, it is pure reason and logic for it to settle accounts with its crimes and then take a permanent seat in the UN Security Council, said the statement issued in support of an appeal of the DPRK Measure Committee for Demanding Compensation to Comfort Women for the Japanese Army and the Victims of Forcible Drafting.    
 The 70 million Koreans can never forget the crimes of militarist Japan, the statement said, stressing that the Japanese government should sincerely apologize for the criminal actions against the Korean nation.
